column2: My giant body has given me troubles since I was born, and now I have grown to the point where I can barely walk without assistance. I am lucky to still have the strength to lift my own head...

Since I was a mere child my body has been growing and growing, and with its growth I have constantly trained it. I now stand an imposing figure, not only tall like a mountain - but also with muscles like a [Root.GetRegionalFerociousAnimal]!

As I get older and older my body will just not stop its incessant growth! My skin is getting thicker, my voice is becoming deeper, my limbs hurt and I have a headache that just will not go away. While my immense stature is more imposing than ever, I feel my spirit slowly leaving my body...
No - from now on I will work out every day!
How is the weather down there?
How long am I for this world?
Why is [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodName] playing this cruel trick on me?

[concerned_relative.GetFirstName] grabbed the bottle out of my hand as I reached for more wine and hurled it against the wall. "You're killing yourself!", [concerned_relative.GetSheHe] shouted, tears in [concerned_relative.GetHerHis] eyes. "Stop drinking, for your family's sake."

[concerned_relative.GetFirstName] passed away recently and though [concerned_relative.GetSheHe] is not around to make sure I don't drink anymore, maybe I should stop to respect [concerned_relative.GetHerHis] memory.
After hardly touching a drop of alcohol for weeks, [concerned_relative.GetFirstName] pointed out how much healthier I appear these days. "You look so much better".
I woke up today craving a drink more than anything. I feel absolutely terrible, but I won't give up. [concerned_relative.GetFirstName] would never forgive me.
I tried to stop I really did, but I found a bottle that had been left out one night and drunk it all down. No one would have known if the servant hadn't told [concerned_relative.GetFirstName].
Due to my massive size I am constantly hitting my head on every door I go through, much to the amusement of anyone passing by.

I know you've been feeling down recently my court physician [physician.GetFirstName] said to me, "Try drinking this it could help, though there are some risks involved". The grey concontion smells vaguely of ash, not the most appealing prospect.

The heavens briefly lit up and the ground shook as the rock from the sky crashed into the castle gardens. I sent my men to investigate and they came back with a lump of a curious metal we have not seen before.

It has been a few weeks since the great rock from the sky landed in my gardens, and the weapon that I ordered forged from the metal is complete. I look upon the sword with wonder – all the way from the heavens and now in my hand!

It was hard to notice at first, but now there can be no doubts about it: my [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] is left-handed. It might be prudent to correct this behavior before it becomes permanent.

My [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] is furious with me for some reason. [From.GetSheHeCap] says that I should always use my right hand whenever I do something, or [From.Religion.GetHighGodName] will be mad at me.

[From.GetFirstName], that devious little brat, has fooled me into believing [From.GetSheHe] had stopped using [From.GetHerHis] right hand. Only this morning I overheard [From.GetHerHim] flaunting [From.GetHerHis] trickery with [From.GetHerHis] playmates!
A conscientious [From.GetBoyGirl], [From.GetFirstName] has decided to obey my order and force [From.GetHerselfHimself] to become right-handed.
The gall on [From.GetFirstName]! [From.GetSheHeCap] outright refused to listen to me, and insists on using [From.GetHerHis] left hand for everything [From.GetSheHe] does!

It was hard to notice at first, but now there can be no doubts about it: my [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] is left-handed. This sort of deviancy should not be allowed to take root, lest it encourages more ungodly behaviors later in [From.GetHerHis] life.
My [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] told me that I should try to always use my right hand instead of the left. [From.GetSheHeCap] says that it will help me in many ways when I am older.
I will try to change, for you.
You will try to stop drinking, but there is a chance you become unwell.
I will never touch another drop in their honor.
I did it for you.
This is meant to be good for me!
I just can't do it.
I guess I'll just wait until nobody is around.
Anything to feel better.
You drink the potion, despite the risk.
The left hand is of the Devil!
Sure, [GetFromRelation]! (Lie)
How dare [From.GetSheHe]!
Outrageous!
How dare you tell me what to do?
You make no attempt to stop drinking.
I need the drink to cope.
It hurts but that just builds character.
No way am I drinking that.
Using your right hand is much more practical.
Alright, [GetFromRelation]. I will do like you say.
The child is fine like this.
No! I like using the left hand!
Teach to §Y[From.GetFirstName]§! about what the scriptures say about [From.GetHerHis] unholy behavior.
Teach to §Y[From.GetFirstName]§! about the tactical restrictions caused by being left-handed..
The Founding of Russia
A New Russia
After many years of tenaciously establishing new borders for our Empire, the time has come to officially declare ourselves the Tsardom of Russia. What a glorious day!
After many years of preparation, [From.GetBestName] has chosen to declare complete sovereignty over [From.GetHerHis] vast territories by founding the Tsardom of Russia.

I have recently inherited [inherited_artifact.GetName], a piece of armor, from [previous_owner.GetTitledFirstName]. "I am not sure it's in any wearable condition, my [Root.GetLordLady]" the quartermaster informs me, as I trace the pattern on it with one hand.

My [Root.GetLordLady], something has been found in the [inherited_artifact.GetArtifactStorage] a scribe catches up with me. "An old book, from [previous_owner.GetTitledFirstName]?" When I join [Root.GetHerHim] for a closer inspection, I have to agree with the assessment. "Old indeed", I sneeze. "We should have someone care for it", the scribe suggests.

What is it? I ask the guards. "You have inherited this... [inherited_artifact.GetName]", one of them explains. "From [previous_owner.GetTitledFirstName]", [Root.GetSheHe] continues. "If you want to keep it, we'll store it for you, [Root.GetMasterMistress]. It might need some maintenance though."

Upon inspecting the [inherited_artifact.GetArtifactStorage], my guards have found [inherited_artifact.GetName], an old weapon. "It must have belonged to [previous_owner.GetTitledFirstName]", they inform me. "Shame it's not in better shape", they mutter.

I have recently inherited an item from [previous_owner.GetTitledFirstName]. "It has probably seen better days, [Root.GetMasterMistress]", the guard tells me, before continuing: "We are sorry to bother you with this, we just weren't sure whether to get rid of it or not".
I have recently inherited [inherited_artifact.GetName] from [previous_owner.GetTitledFirstName]. It is not in good shape.
The [inherited_artifact.GetArtifactStorage] currently houses a valuable item I inherited from [previous_owner.GetTitledFirstName]. It might need someone to look after it though.
All shall bow to [Root.GetBestName]...!
That hardly sounds necessary.
I suppose it could be worth something, one day...
For sentimental reasons, I could have someone look it over.
I'll pay to maintain it.
Maintenance is to be expected, I guess.
Money is not an issue.
We cannot put a price on heirlooms like this. Spare no expense!
Looks rather useless to me.
We cannot afford to maintain all the old junk thrown our way.
This metal will make for a truly legendary blade!
You set your smiths to work on forging a weapon from the metal.
This is truly a glorious weapon.
What the...
This was a gift from [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]. It should go to the church.
It's just metal. Sell it, and do it quickly.

I should always strive to look at my best if I wish to find a good husband to live the rest of my life with. It has not been an easy job, but, with the proper care, I think I am looking better and better every day.

While all this time spent outside is undoubtedly good for my health, it has not worked as well for my looks. Every night, when I return home, my clothes are soiled in dirt and mud, and my hair bears the stink of wet dogs.

I should always strive to look at my best if I wish to find a good wife to live the rest of my life with. It has not been an easy job, but, with the proper care, I think I am looking better and better every day.
I should always strive to look at my best for my beloved spouse. It has not been an easy job, but, with the proper care, I think I am looking better and better every day.

While my training has greatly improved my physical prowess and my skills in combat, it has not had a positive effect on my looks. My skin has grown rough and blemished by a countless amount of old bruises and small scars.
Why should I care how I look when I spend most of my time alone?

With [From.GetFirstName] spending most of [From.GetHerHis] days cloistered, is it surprising that [From.GetSheHe] has such a poor care of [From.GetHerHis] looks? The [From.GetBoyGirl] always looks like a vagabond.

[From.GetFirstName] scolded me about my lack of grooming. [From.GetSheHeCap] claims that, regardless of my cloistered lifestyle, I should still strive to maintain the dignified look of a [Root.GetTitle].
I always need to make sure everyone sees how important I am.

[From.GetFirstName] is obsessed with [From.GetHerHis] looks. [From.GetSheHeCap] often avoids playing with other children just for fear of getting [From.GetHerHis] clothes dirty or ruin [From.GetHerHis] hair.
[From.GetFirstName] has scolded me for being so skittish. [From.GetSheHeCap] says that I should stop worrying about my looks so much and spend more time playing instead.
There are so many interesting things to do in [Root.Capital.GetName]. Why worry about cleaning myself, if I'll get dirty again?
[From.GetFirstName] has warned me that I should take greater care of myself, and that is unbecoming of a [Root.GetTitle] to always be dirty and uncouth as I am.

If I wish to be successful in my amorous adventures, I must look at my very best. Nobody will fall for my words if I look like a toad. It has not been an easy job, but, with the proper care, I think I am managing to look better and better every day.

[From.GetFirstName] spends all day playing in the dirt and never seems to care about [From.GetHerHis] own looks, not even during formal occasions, when a proper decor would be expected from a [From.GetBoyGirl] of [From.GetHerHis] stature.
How can I be expected to do anything? I must maintain a clean and dignified look for the masses.

[From.GetFirstName] is enamored with [From.GetHerHis] looks, always trying to appear at [From.GetHerHis] best and always using [From.GetHerHis] necessity to keep clean and groomed as an excuse to avoid any task that might bother [From.GetHerHim].
[From.GetFirstName] has insinuated that my obsession with grooming is just an excuse to avoid my responsibilities and that I should not fear getting dirty every once in a while.
I am the prettiest [Root.GetBoyGirl] in [Root.Capital.GetName]!
But they are all filthy!
Was there any doubt about it?
I cannot afford myself to look like this!
And so what? Looks do not matter.
But why care how I look? I am [Root.GetTitle]!
Books do not judge appearances.
I will wash later!
But what is the point of that?
Indeed!
But I am not a peasant!
Old Treasures
